benchmark_details.name: Financial Language Model (FiLM)
benchmark_details.overview: FiLM is a Financial Language Model trained on a diverse financial corpus, designed to improve the generalization performance of financial PLMs across multiple financial tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the generalization performance of financial language models by leveraging a diverse corpus of financial data.

data.source: A broad range of financial documents including news articles, SEC filings, earnings call transcripts, research papers, and more.
data.annotation: Data was processed for cleaning and deduplication, details of specific annotations are not specified.

methods: Fine-tuning on financial tasks using sequence classification and token classification methods.
methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on model evaluations across multiple financial NLP tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted based on F1 scores for classification tasks and accuracy for question answering tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared to financial PLMs such as FinBERT and general domain PLMs like BERT and RoBERTa.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluation across six financial NLP tasks.
